Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: L0calY0cal
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Close to Via Veneto but away from the traffic noise. The staff was wonderful. The breakfast was great. Our room was very nice and impeccably clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Nordkvinnen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April 2012 together with friends. The hotel is located a few steps up from via Veneto close to Hard Rock Cafe. Not far from Barberini or Spanish Steps. Our junior suite was very nice, huge bed and sitting area. It also had a very nice sunny balcony. Staff was very nice. This was myt 6th visit to Rome, and I will be back (tossed a coin in the Trevi fountain this time too!). It might well be to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Frankymann
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, the location is close to a metro stop. The receptionroom is in avery classy style, neat and tiedy. The staff is friendly and helpfull. We went to Rome for the six nations game, went tto the stadion for Scotland - Itlay. Later we went to the hotel bar, very elegant, various small rooms with leather armchairs. It is recommended to visit the bar not to late in the evening because its closing time. All in all a great place stay, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mouse010
Reviews.Content: We took the bus shuttle from the airport and then picked up a taxi to take us to the hotel which took about an hour in all. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted very nicely and our luggage was taken up to our room which was on the first floor and overlooked the front of the hotel. The room was slightly outdated - the bathroom sadly was in need of refurbishment although everything worked satisfactorily. Our filter coffee machine didn't work but we were soon brought Nescafe instant which suited us well. The second day our TV wouldn' turn on and the mini bar wasn't cold which we reported and this was rectified almost immediately. Nothing was too much trouble although of course these hiccups shouldn't really occur in a 4 star hotel. The breakfast room was very comfortable although in my opinion the hot breakfast offerings should be taken away as for the three mornings we were there the food was always cold - such a shame and waste of food. Mushrooms, fried eggs, fried bread, baked beans, bacon, frankfurters and scrambled eggs were all on offer but it was all cold. Everything else offered was extremely good quality, fresh and tinned fruits, cheeses, hams, yogurts, cakes, jams, biscuits and cereals so you wouldn't go hungry. A very nice touch is the Friday evening cocktail party which my husband and I attended - it is from 18.30 and a very nice harpist was playing which was lovelly and relaxing to listen to after a long afternoon of touring around Rome. There were plenty of canapes on offer and we were offer two glasses of wine each so you don't have to have cocktails. All in all a very nice stay in Rome - very convenient for most of the sights. We did the tour bus with the two day ticket which was an excellent way of getting our bearings. The bed in our room was huge and very comfortable with plenty of extra pillows and blankets if required.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at bargain price”
Reviews.Author: tennisstar1524
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night before moving over to a much more expensive and prestigious one for business purposes. Moving to what was considered a higher end hotel made me realize what a great bargain La Residenza is! At La Residenza I stayed in a suite on the 1st floor. It was very spacious with a sitting room that had doors that could be closed going in to the bedroom. Then there was a very small hallway with a closet that led in to the big bathroom. The decor in the room was somewhat outdated but it was clean and comfortable. The one let down was that this room had no out the windows at all, basically looking at a wall. The staff was great and friendly. For a little more than it would cost to take a taxi, a member of the staff will pick you up from the airport and drive you the almost 30 minutes to the hotel. Our driver carried our luggage and loaded it into the car as well as unloaded it when we got to the hotel and had it sent to our room. He also spoke English well enough to point out some sights along the drive. After such a long flight it was nice not to have to navigate to find a taxi and explain where we wanted to go. Breakfast every morning is included and, with prices in Rome being so expensive, it's a great thing to take advantage of. They had everything you could want in a breakfast and you could have a typical Italian or American meal. Upon request the breakfast room server will make you a fresh cup of cappicino as well. The location is also a plus of this hotel as it was right around the corner from the one I stayed at next on Via Venato. It's an easy walk to the Spanish Steps and the Borghese Gardens. Overall, great stay and was very impressed at the price considering how well it measured up to my next hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Always a nice stay....”
Reviews.Author: 4everwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Residenza 3 times now, and it remains consistently good. Clean, spacious rooms, bountiful full breakfast buffet each morning, and a front-desk staff that is always willing help with everything from restaurant reservations to taxis. Also, this hotel is just a few minutes' walk to Piazza di Spagna and Via Veneto. You can even walk to the Vatican from there (about 20 minutes). All around great hotel for the money in a centrally located position in Rome. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to both business and pleasure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Paul K
Reviews.Content: Came to this place with my family. Breakfast is the worst breakfast I have had, considering the price we paid. the staff were very unfriendly and unhelpful, un-professional.The rooms we found to be very cramped and a littje dirty.Its amazing the rates they charge for so little in return. Be aware, there are better rooms and hotel in Rome I am sure for the same rates. What a big mistake coming here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: AW67_11
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here in early November and couldn't have chosen a better hotel. Staff were very helpful, from recommending and making reservations for dinners, giving directions and arranging transport. The room was much larger than expected with a large bathroom. It was in a quiet location (yes there was a lap dancing club opposite but this didn't cause any noise or trouble) within easy walking distance to the main sights. Nothing was too much trouble and we would very happily return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Janey-Debs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Residenza from 14th -18th October. The location was great - a quiet road but well situated for most of the sights and public transport. The reception staff couldn't have been more knowledgeable and helpful which greatly helped and enhanced our first visit to this amazing city. The decor and furniture are not modern but it is well kept and very pleasant. We enjoyed the welcome cocktail party on Friday night - a very nice gesture. Our room was huge. It was a bit quirky but we loved it - particulary the huge balcony! The breakfast included in the price was more than adequate (good, fresh coffee was available from a machine if you know to ask!) although seating in the dining room was a bit limited and we did have to wait for a free table one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced with limited unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Captiva8
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was boring. Cold eggs, dry bread, horrible coffee. Front desk is mostly unhelpful and unfriendly. One guy....on most afternoons...is very rude. Rolls his eyes if we asked for directions and turned his back in us rather than answer. Maybe they do not like Americans? Would not stay here again. Strip club right across the street was also a turn off!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty typical hotel, good breakfast selection”
Reviews.Author: LynnieLou619
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent trip to Rome for one night. Near the Villa Borghese park, this part of town was quiet and pretty upscale. The hotel looks fairly recently updated on the ground floor but the rooms look a bit warn. Our double room on the third floor had the most massive bed! I think it was two doubles pushed together and is likely what you get if you ask for a triple (because I'm fairly certain that the couch pulls out). It was mostly full of middle-aged Americans when we were there. The breakfast had a large selection and two waiters. It's included in the cost of the room. I don't have any serious qualms with the place except that it's pretty expensive for what you get. For 220 per night (Euro), I would expect something a bit fancier, but Rome is a pretty expensive city and this is pretty par for the course I'd imagine. Like most other hotels in Europe, the bed is hard and the elevator tiny. Via Emilia doesn't show up on many of the big city maps, so it might be hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cheeni924
Reviews.Content: We actually had a lovely experience at this hotel. Our room was spacious and we had a private patio with a table. The bathroom shower was terrific. The toilet was a bit cramped the way it was situated, but that's Europe! The staff were very helpful. And we enjoyed the breakfast, however I must agree with other reviews that the tables were a bit cramped. But the on the griddle they will make you whatever eggs you like, and we found the breakfast to be above good.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment - A Four Star??? Not in our Book”
Reviews.Author: amyoscar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had such fond memories of La Residenza from our first trip to Rome in the mid-90's. We particularly remembered a large and pleasant breakfast room with an amazing assortment of hot and cold delights. We also remembered gracious staff and special levels of attention paid to the smallest detail. So when our plans called for another visit to Rome we decided to go back. The fact that it was in the top 100 of over 1200 hotels in Rome also made us feel pretty good. We stayed in three star hotels in Naples and Amafi and had wonderful experiences in both so in learning that the hotel now had a fourth star, we thought that we would enjoy the extra pampering and luxury that a four star would bring. What a mistake! After our experience, one has to wonder how often the "star checkers" revisit once an additional star is earned. On the plus side, our room, even though it faced the front, was quiet and the extra wooden shutters helped to keep out the morning sun. What shall we say about the desk staff? While one of the individuals with whom we interacted were helpful and pleasant, that was not the norm. We would characterize their attitudes as ranging from pompous and annoying to downright rude. From no one helping us bring our luggage up the flight of stairs at their entrance, to questions being answered with a sneer and condescension, this part of the hotel was the worst 4 star experience we had ever had. We don't blame the hotel for having a "lap dance" establishment nearby. You can't control who will be your neighbors but you can most certainly control what happens inside your place. The breakfast experience had also changed greatly since our last trip and not for the better. The room is now much smaller than it used to be since they moved in a large griddle into the room (it used to be out of sight in another room). As a result, the seating is so tight and the tables so close together that guests need to get up from their chair and move out of the way to allow others guests to get to the tables that are in the next row back. On this trip, Rome was our last stop so we were fresh from being treated wonderfully in Naples and Amalfi. Certainly, the first thing that happened when we entered a dining room was that we were greeted and asked what our hot beverage of choice was. Here, you were lucky if you got the attention of one of the serving people, who were so busy talking to each other (in very loud voices) that it was rare that they ever looked at their guests to see if anyone needed anything. The food itself was a shadow of our memories. How can a four star Italian hotel have inedible mozzarella and tomatoes? The eggplant and other "griddle" items were so badly done and so tasteless that it was almost laughable. The eggs we requested were OK but the rest of the food was so awful that I was tempted to skip the breakfast (I can't remember the last time THAT happened.) On the plus side, the bread was good (as long as you toasted it) and they did have a nice array of cereals and juices. The rooms look like they are in a bad 70's time warp with broken tiles in the bathroom and one of the worst shower heads we had ever had in a hotel at this price point. Luckily we were able to use the secondary smaller shower head which provided decent pressure but the bathtub was so narrow, you could barely get under that shower head. They even had a price list for the tea fixings in the room. There was no wi-fi connection - just a cable which functioned poorly or not at all. I have never had an internet connection through a cable that only provided one bar of strength. Although we complained a number of times, the front desk shrugged it off and said it wasn't their fault, it was outside the hotel. Don't believe that for a minute. The room was so poorly lit that even the bedside lamps were really more dims than lights. We feel badly for anyone who tried to read a real book with that little light. I-Pad users would not be affected. There were few if any electrical outlets and those that existed were poorly placed for using your computer at the desk. All in all, we were very disappointed and after reading some of the more recent reviews I have to wonder if we were staying at the same hotel? Unfortunately, we did.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: cbraeder60305
Reviews.Content: My 12-year old daughter and I stayed here with my parents (who have stayed at this hotel for many years) in April 2011. I t was a great location within walking distance and/or cab rides to many places. The front desk staff was superb and very tolerant of our attempts at speaking Italian (they do speak impeccable English). One suggestion -- ask for a room at the back of the property. The front of the hotel does overlook a night club that can be noisy at night. They were very gracious about moving us as soon as we mentioned it. Excellent breakfast as well! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff- Amazing Breakfast Buffet- Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyMan002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at this hotel after a Mediterranean cruise. Without knowing the city of Rome well, we were searching for something safe and in a central location. This hotel met both of our goals, and had a few extra very nice perks. Location: La Residenza is located in a beautiful, upscale neighborhood. Very safe. It is a 5-10 minute walk to both the Trevi fountain and the Spanish Steps. The Colosseum felt like it was a little more than a mile, 20-25 minute walk with traffic. The Train Station was about a 20 minute walk. Manageable with light baggage, but difficult for us with heavy suitcases. The cab drivers wanted 25 Euros, which we declined as we felt it was overpriced. All in all, if you don't mind a little walking, everything we wanted to see was within walking distance. Staff: Friendly and helpful. They provided us with a wonderful little map of the area upon check-in. In addition, they helped secure a taxi ride to the airport that morning, which was 45 Euros. 55 Euros if you wanted a private car. Extra Perks: Here is where the hotel really shined, in our opinion. At 6:30pm they invited all of their guests "for a drink", which was actually finger foods with beverage service from the bar. No charge. Very nice setup. The wifi was free. As any traveler knows, this is very handy. The breakfast buffet was absolutely out of this world. Better than the cruise buffet for sure. Beautiful setup, wide display of foods. Fruit and water were also provided to us free of charge in the hotel room. Rooms: The rooms were fine. As an American, we're used to large, upscale rooms. By European standards this was a large room, but by American standards it felt just normal. Clean, wouldn't describe as "modern" but was just fine for one day. The decor in the rest of the hotel was nicer. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th stay at La Residenza”
Reviews.Author: travelon002
Reviews.Content: We returned to La Residenza this summer for our fourth visit and we still love the place. While the rooms cannot be described as modern in decor, they are spacious and comfortable with excellent air conditioning and all the amenities one could want. We understand that the hotel is soon to undergo a major remodeling, and we look forward to returning to stay in updated rooms. The lobby bar and sitting rooms are beautifully decorated with antiques and Persian rugs, and the hotel building is lovely, situated in an excellent neighborhood of fine architecture. hotel is close to major sites, restaurants, and shopping streets, but it is on the quiet Via Emilia. The breakfast buffet is huge, always providing enough to carry us through a day of sightseeing. One of the best parts of each visit to La Residenza has been the outstanding hotel staff., who without fail have been knowledgeable, helpful, and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Marion6607
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, convenient to Barberina metro station. Staff very nice and courteous. Only two small gripes, the lift was far too small and the bathroom was unbelievably warm and stuffy, we couldnt work out how to turn off the radiators. We stayed for 2 nights after our cruise and had a 2 bedroom suite with a rooftop terrace, so we were delighted. On checking out we were bringing our own luggage down and as there wasnt enough room to manoeuvre the large cases out the door, we knocked over and broke the jug of the coffee maker, for which we were charged 40 euro which was a bit steep. All in all though, it was a great hotel and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Villa Borghese and Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Marysvillian
Reviews.Content: We wanted to see the galleries in the Villa Borghese and this hotel is only a few minutes walk away. It is also close to the Metro station (Barberini). Apart from the lap dancing establishments across the street, it is well located for seeing much of the tourist sites. The rooms are dated but feel quite plush with very high ceilings and ours had a private balcony. The room had facilities for boiling water but charge 1.5 euros per tea/coffee bag!! The shower was over the bath with a fully enclosed screen... not for people with agility problems or difficulty squeezing through the fairly narrow opening. Interesting ear-blasting jet-like sound effects can be produced from the hair dryer if you use it for more than a few seconds. Our room was at the front but we had no difficulty with the noise (even though I'm a very light sleeper) once the windows and shutters were closed. The staff were fairly polite and helpful but not really willing to do anything extra. eg Vincenzo, on the reception desk almost lost his temper with an Italian guest and the breakfast cook was completely indifferent to most guests. Would I go back? No, but I would recommend it to people wanting to stay in that part of Rome but not to people with mobility problems (because of the shower).

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AussieEmma
Reviews.Content: We arrived late afternoon in Rome feeling very tired but we were so close to some of the major sights that we couldn't help but explore the city. And I fell in love! The hotel also offered a beautiful sitting area, free wi fi, bar service and the most sumptuous breakfast I've seen in a while. While the room was older style it was large and very clean. I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel ... good value”
Reviews.Author: Genevieve61
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel and amazing service... great breakfast... overall, a very good value for Rome. Subway is close although we mostly walked. Was one of Frommer's Best moderate price hotel. they deserve it! You will be treated like royalty... with slippers by your bed... looks and feels very high end.

Reviews.Title: “A very special place!”
Reviews.Author: Amphotog
Reviews.Content: My wife, adult son and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for a total of 5 nights before and after visiting Positano on the Amalfi Coast. What a special place! Vincenza and his colleague concierges were incredibly helpful! No matter what we asked them, they went out of their way to ensure we received the help we were in need of. The breakfasts are another major feature of this hotel. We have never seen such a broad offerring and it was all of high quality. The rooms were of very high quality, as is the lobby and adjoining lounge area. It is well situated so you can walk to many key areas of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Lacked Some Details and Warmth of a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimkaren77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location near the Spanish Steps. The double room was small but OK. Hair dryer outdated. Great shower but difficult to use. Free breakfast was very good each of the four days we stayed there. Our trip was delayed 2 days due to Delta and the hotel would not credit the two nights even though I called them and my son was staying in a single room. Finally they gave me 20% off the two nights I had to eat. One person on the desk was not friendly nor very helpful. Also their restaurant recommendation nearby was over priced and lacked customers. Food in Rome was disappointing compared to Florence and Venice. Over all would check out another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: 111jenny
Reviews.Content: This smaller boutique hotel was recommended to us by others that had stayed there. We felt it offered very good value for money and the facilities, whilst older style and more conservative, it suited our needs. The breakfast is fantastic compared to others in Rome but the standout is the staff who were helpful, courteous and always aiming to please It is a good location, the back streets close to Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese . It is a classy part of the city and we felt very safe walking around at night. We managed to easily negotiate the electric bus system with stops nearby as well as trains, but taxi fares were still relatively cheap from the area to the main tourist sites. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get the cheapest rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Festivamax
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here 2 nights and were not thrilled, but it is a perfectly okay hotel. But we tried to go cheap and wound up with a "basement" room with windows opening up below ground - or seemingly below ground. I really did not want to look closely and kept windows closed as much as possible. Avoid the ground floor. Breakfast attendants were almost surly. Desk staff tried to be accommodating, but could not understand my request for an Internet Cafe (no computers available to guests). But the bellman understood and I got there (very close to hotel)! Bellman was great - best staff by far. Would try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Travelers349
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quiet street just off the Via Veneto and is lovely inside and out. The reception desk staff members are friendly and very helpful, and will arrange airport/ship transfers and Rome tours upon request. Our rooms and our friends’ rooms were clean, well furnished and comfortable. The A/C was very effective in Rome’s heat and humidity. The breakfast provided, consisting of a large array of hot and cold items, is easily as fine a breakfast as can be found in Rome. I believe you will be as delighted with your stay as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gardoz
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome 4X and everytime we have stayed at the La Residenza. I would describe it as a business mans hotel. It's off the Via Venito, near the Spanis Steps. The rooms are modern, very clean as it the whole hotel. Staff is excellent. They make you stay very pleasent and comfortable. They serve a full american buffet breakfast with many choices of both hot and cold foods. The hotal is also not far from many restaurants. We have stayed there on pleasure trips to Rome and we intend to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Staff, but must have earned its four stars long, long ago”
Reviews.Author: OpinionistaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Location had issues: We stayed at the Hotel La Residenza as a family with three kids, and I had found it on hotels.com with a four-star rating for a great price. As we walked up to the hotel to check in at night, we saw a "gentlemen's club" (AKA strip club) across the street and a few other seedy bars with men loitering outside down the block. Ruh-roh. Nevertheless, the hotel is only two short blocks from a fancy street in Rome with high-end shops and hotels. It is not too far (ten minutes or so) to walk to the Spanish Steps, but a bit more of a hike to the bulk of Rome's tourist attractions, so we ended up taking taxis when our kids got tired. STAFF: The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer, helped us find our way around Rome, made parking our rental car in front of the hotel quite painless, and took care of arranging a transfer to the airport for us at the end of our stay. COMMON AREAS: The small lobby area was old-fashioned and decorated in an opulent style with red carpeting and expensive draperies. ROOMS/BATHROOMS: The rooms were ample in terms of size (surprisingly, the beds were all very large, with the king bed was even larger than an American-sized king, and our bathrooms were big for by European hotel standards. Both the rooms and bathrooms were clean, but very, very dated. If this hotel got four stars, it had to be at least twenty years ago. FOOD: The included breakfast was an elaborate hot and cold buffet, with delicious pastries, eggs, and the works. There were overpriced pizza places within a few blocks, but no little corner markets for picking up drinks, snacks and sandwiches nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Warm!! Be back !!”
Reviews.Author: RafainLA
Reviews.Content: MY wife and I together with my brother and Sister in law stayed there for a couple of days and we had a very nice comfortable room. The staff was very friendly and helpful in all our requests and needs. We needed to ship some luggage to another hotel in Milan and they were very helpful in putting the shipment of the luggage together for us. The hotel is decorated very nice and its always clean. Breakfast was great in quality and quantity. Location was very good, close to many attractions and shopping We will definitely look to stay there again in future trips. We had a great time there Rafael

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LCLandry
Reviews.Content: We were at La Residenza for five nights and only wish it could have been more. The location was great for us; short walks to the Metro, Spanish Steps, Trevi, Borghese and much of central Rome. La Residenza is a hidden gem just one block off the Via Veneto where there are BIG ticket hotels. The hotel definitely has a 1940s elegance vibe. However, that should not be interpreted as code for shabby. We found everything to be in excellent condition and clean. We had the Junior Suite on the 5th floor. It provided a living room, bedroom, bath and a huge private balcony. The breakfasts were fantastic with fresh fruits, cheese, meats, and even eggs and bacon if you liked. All of the staff were attentive and very helpful. In particular, we interacted with Vicente, Catlin and Emmanuel (the manager) everyday. Vicente always had a smile for us when we dragged in at 10pm after a long day of walking and sightseeing. He would ask us about our day and our plans for the next and make perfect suggestions for itineraries and restaurants. No matter how wonderful a facility may be, it truly is the staff who make you want to come back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: rkuch
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff, clean and comfortable room, great location, near Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Comfortable bed. Great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: taandrah4
Reviews.Content: Having trawled internet sites and reviews for hotels we finally settled on La Residenza - and what a find. This hotel must be the best kept secret in Rome and is an oasis of calm in a very busy city. The location is superb - just off the busy Via Veneto and in walking distance to the Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Spagna or Barberini metro stops, but in a lovely quiet road. From the moment we stepped into reception to the moment we left we were treated with five star service. The rooms were extremely spacious and the breakfast was outstanding as was the service. We cannot thank Vincenzo, Antonello and Andrea enough for making our stay special. Thank you - we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: GkMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Residenza in April and loved the hotel. We took a Junior Suite (which had a balcony). The hotel is lovely and has a graciousness from another era. The front desk clerks (Antonello and Andrea) were terrific...so helpful and friendly. The manager was always walking around during the day and checking to see what was going on. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the subway. We walked to the Trevi Fountain (approx 15 minutes) and we walked back from the Borghese Gallery (20 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, really recommended”
Reviews.Author: DarranT97
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome earlier this month based on reviews from Trip Advisor - and were not disappointed; great staff, really handy location for walking and the metro (30 minutes walk to the Collesseum which was as far out as we planned to go, very near Spanish steps etc), and a clean and large room (we booked a mini-suite and got a large room with balcony). Breakfast was as per many other reviews; really great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: grigorisdim
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. The staff was very friendly, the room was big for European standard and was very clean. You can walk from the hotel to every major tourist attraction in the Rome. The metro station is 5 min walk from the hotel. The staff speak English and always give you the assistance that you ask. Very good breakfast. We stayed at room 1, in the ground floor.The central heating was to strong,so we slept with open window.Also was a noise that was maybe from the elevator

Reviews.Title: “Warm and gracious service in a comfortable, understated setting”
Reviews.Author: mllohman
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay in La Residenza and we can't recommend it enough. Wonderful location, a warm and caring staff, fantastic breakfast and clean, comfortable rooms all combine to make this a great, affordable place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 72goldie
Reviews.Content: This very comfortable hotel serves a great breakfast. The reception is friendly and knowledgeable about area restaurants and the like. The hotel is near the Borghese Gardens, Spanish Steps and Via Veneto. We stayed for almost a week and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: connexis
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time choosing a hotel in Rome as it was our first visit to this great city. I am happy I made the right choice as everything was up to high standards. The staff were friendly and spoke good English. The breakfasts were perfect and definitely more than we expected to have: fresh pineapple,melon,grapes,plums and more others. We stayed 7 nights in a junior suite and it was so quiet that we could sleep up to 10am and heard no noise from outside (only once maybe). We pre-booked a baby cot and it was there when we arrived (the charge was 20eur per day). Complimentary fruits upon arrival and drinks on Friday night were also provided. One night we went out to Vladimiro restaraunt (1 block away from the hotel) and had a fantastic meal (no pizza there, only meat and pasta dishes but absolutely delicious!). Next time in Rome I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotelin perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MEL41535
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for three nights and this was the perfect hotel - wonderful breakfast buffet, room was comfortable and quiet with coffee machine. A short walk to Spanish Steps, great restaurants and lovely evening walks. Cannot say enough about the staff who were welcoming and provided all the help and suggestions to make our stay a memorable one. Great Friday night cocktail party to meet the other guests. Highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “QUITE THE FIND!”
Reviews.Author: elmarko
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little 4 story, 26 room boutique hotel in fabulous location. It is literally 10 minutes from the Spanish Steps and really close to Metro Station. Perfect ( and very quiet) location on a side street near the Via Veneto.Great for exploring all the attractions in Rome. Extraordinarily professional, friendly staff. Arrived after red eye around 10:30 and our room was ready! Amazing for Europe if you travel there frequently. Can arrange for all types of tours and transportation. FABULOUS BREAKFAST ROOM WITH HOT AND COLD BUFFET INCL. ALL KINDS OF FRESH FRUIT. This is definitely a solid 4 star hotel worthy of all the praise in other reviews. I can promise you a wonderful stay here and you can believe all the reviews. This is quite the find!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Calpoke
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for four days prior to a cruise and we loved this hotel. What did we like? - Great safe location within walking distance of many sites and the subway - Junior Suite was very large with large bathroom; very clean - Fantastic breakfast with great variety of breakfast foods - Excellent service with much helpful advice No negatives to report..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: 99Sol99
Reviews.Content: We arrived late one evening, and the bellman greeted us by name which I was surprised considering we had just arrived, very pleased. We had a fruit basket and water waiting in our room. The buffet breakfast was remarkable of selection, more than would get at a restaurant. The hotel is within walking distance of many great tourist spots and quiet in the evening. There were so many great restaurants down the street from this hotel. We will definitely return and stay here again. One thing I would like to mention is make sure if you bring your own tea (as I did) that you are not charged. I only drink green tea and by using their teacup, the maid assumed it was their tea, although nothing was missing and wrote down a $4.50 charge but left what was missing blank. They did not charge us upon check-out after explanation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the perfect location making a wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: paulac092
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked impressive on arrival, grand red carpet along the entrance and spacious, airy and very impressive lounge areas. The reception staff, concierge and porter (Simon) were excellent. They answered all of our questions regarding siteseeing and travelling in Rome. Breakfast as per previous reviews was truly amazing, and included everything you could possibly wish to eat. A 5 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps, 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain, and just a 15-20 minute car ride to the main attractions. We actually used one of the open-top hop on hop off buses which was ideal. A lovely hotel and a lovely weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A great find on tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: tony2mayston
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a result of a search on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed.The location is just off the Via Veneto in a quiet road.The reception desk was very helpful to us,particularly with information when we first arrived. The room was spacious and comfortable.An excellent buffet breakfast is provided with a wide choice available. Tony Mayston

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomedations”
Reviews.Author: sophiasouthcarolina
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times. Staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. Breakfast buffet is lovely and also they cook specials to order.This is one of the quality hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant in many ways”
Reviews.Author: JSOfan
Reviews.Content: I was delighted by this hotel, which was elegant. The reception staff were dressed in tails as if they were going to the opera. There was a welcome basket of fruit in the room. The room was spacious and comfortable, and was equipped with hard-wire internet access. Beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was well-appointed. Breakfast left nothing to be desired. It was a short walk to Trevi Fountain and to Hard Rock Cafe. I'd definitely stay there again, and I highly recommend La Residenza as a comfortable, clean and friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking around Rome”
Reviews.Author: zebradoubleu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at La Residenza four days in July and another night in August. The personnel working at this hotel were fabulous! From the concierge at reception (both shifts), to the breakfast crew and the bell boys. Our room was cleaned daily while we were out walking around in the city and we returned to a spotless room. I asked suggestions for restaurants from the concierge at the front desk, and told him I wanted to go where the food was great and very little tourists. The two suggestions caused us to have some of the best meals in Italy. We will definitely stay at La Residenza again, and it may even become our home away from home in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: BikeTuscany
Reviews.Content: We took a train down from Florence and walked the fairly long stroll from the Termini, arriving a bit weary, but were delighted by the friendly and helpful reception. Our room was very comfortable with a well-appointed bath, and the hotel quickly delivered a welcome basket of fruit to our room. We had both a coffeemaker and a tea pot and a good cable connection to the internet. The location was great, with a Metro stop only a few blocks away to help us get to the Terme di Caracalla for a performance of Rigoletto. The hotel put the breakfast in a room down a few steps from the ground floor, with tables arranged around a large central serving area overflowing with breads, fruits, juices, meats, cheeses, and almost anything else we could have imagined. We strongly recommend this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mactravels78
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in La Residenza at both ends of a Med cruise. The location, just off the Via Veneto is perfect and the hotel is extremely quiet. Once a large residence it now has generous rooms and one of the best, full breakfasts included. The staff is nowleadgable and friendly and service is excellent. The price was very fair for a 4 star hotel in the best area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel in need of refurbishing all around”
Reviews.Author: natbel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed here before in 2005 on a trip with family, and I had positive memories of that stay - the hotel wasn't plush, but was comfortable, with very welcoming staff and an excellent included breakfast buffet. This led me to choose it again on a return trip with another couple. Bad idea - either my memory failed me, or the hotel has gone down in quality in the last 5 years. The lobby is decent - they've replaced some couches with newer ones that seem to be covered in vinyl or pleather - doesn't really go with the rest of the hotel. We checked in early and our rooms weren't available - that was fine, but they they seemed really irritated at having to put up our luggage for an hour until the rooms were available, and when I asked to get back into my luggage after they took it away (I had forgotten to pull out a medication), they made it seem like it was such an impossible chore, I told them just to forget it. Plus, when we checked in, the gentleman at the front desk called someone to check on the status of the rooms, and I missed part of the conversation, but what I did pick up, seemed to imply that our relative youth was playing into the assignment of rooms. When we finally returned to the hotel in the late afternoon, our bags had been delivered to the rooms, but the rooms themselves were a huge disappointment - both were very dark, facing interior walls. The furnishings seem about 20-30 years old, and just sort of tired, linens are on the threadbare side. The bathroom was functional at best. Breakfast buffet had definitely deteriorated - lots of options, none of them very good - everything seemed a little old, a little stale. Generally felt depressing. Luckily we were only there for one night. This is a 3-star hotel, at best. The price was good, but I would happily pay more in the future for a better, friendlier hotel. The charm and warmth of the staff that I remembered from my previous stay had totally vanished, and instead the hotel staff made us feel like it was a chore for them to be there. That, combined with the tired furnishings will keep me from ever returning. I was embarrassed that I even suggested it to the friends we were traveling with!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Fi_and_Matt
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Residenza is very conveniently located. Our room was large with an enormous bed. The bathroom was dated and very long and skinny making sitting on the toilet difficult! Breakfast was in a strange downstairs room but offered a big selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price, clean and quiet but very average hotel with bad beds.”
Reviews.Author: tourist22903
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights based on very favorable reviews and good price with great location. I am surprised no one has commented on the tired and lumpy beds and pillows and the garish decorations. Our room was a junior suite so it was large, but the bright navy carpeting and futon sofas were combined with red chairs, gold upholstery and curtains, red twin blankets on the large bed, and pink walls, with 1950's type ugly wood panelling and trim thrown in. I do not know how this rates 4 stars and would never go back. They offer virtually no toiletries so we used our own; they had tiny tea bag little packets of shampoo and some shower caps, nothing more. They did turn down out beds but did not change the towels at night. Towels were pretty thin but less tired than the robes. I guess they list all of their "amenities" and have somehow represented they are much better than reality. The breakfast buffet was huge, but though they had three kinds of eggs, none was edible. The boiled eggs were apparently cooked for about 1 minute. On the second day, after having two basically raw eggs crush in my hands I asked if they might be able to cook them until firm and the surly waitress said I could have a fried egg from the buffet if I wanted something different. The fried eggs and the scrambled sat on a heating element that, even at 7 am, just after they opened, had them all dried out and turned a nasty orange color. They offer juice, but it is sour, canned type of orange juice. There are loads of pastries though the couple we tried seemed stale, too. We had yogurt and fresh fruit with granola which were all good and limited breakfast to that. Other than the waitress, the staff was very pleasant and it was a quiet place, especially in our room on the back. Not so sure about the rooms on the street as there are two lap dance businesses across the street on the otherwise quiet block. One night there were several women in negligees out front so it could potentially get noisy if you were on the front. Despite the price and great location, I would never stay again or recommend it unless price and location would trump any other considerations. The clientele were so old we joked when a young couple came in one morning that they must not have gotten the word that they were booked into an elder hostel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: LondonJohnH
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, tucked away one block off the Via V. Veneto. The guest rooms are a good size well appointed and comfortable and the breakfast is probably the best I have had in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location to recover from jet lag”
Reviews.Author: roaminsoul
Reviews.Content: While being a small hotel, it is subject to the risks of being oversold, as happened on our first night, they had arranged alternative accomodations a block away and transported our luggage. So the event did not cause any major inconvenience. We checked in the next day into a lovely room with a balcony for a pleasant stay. You can see the "culture" of the hotel is oriented to the traditional objectives of making guests feel comfortable. We had stayed there some years ago, and all of our pleasant recollections were merely confirmed. It's fully deserving of its star rating

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bsingh68
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from Rome where i stayed with my partner at La Residenza. It is two stops from Termini which itself is on a direct route from the airport. The Hotel lobby is elegant and bright and a welcome sight after the madness of Rome. The staff are ever so friendly and speak excellent English. There is a small bar which IS open in the evenings and an excellent barman in Gaetano who really looked after us. The rooms are comfortable and we had possibly the biggest bed in the universe but the mattress was a bit firm. The bathroom probably could do with a bit of updating but it is clean and functional and in reality who goes on holiday to spend more time than is absolutely essential in the bathroom?? The Hotel is in an excellent location near Barbirini station and in a very safe. upmarket area with the merican embassy a stones throw away and the Savoy around the corner. I have read some reviews which mention the lap dancing club acros the road but i really don't see why that is a problem it's not like they are going to jump out and drag you in, for the most part we hardly noticed it was there apart from a couple of nights when the punters were coming out but then i had the window wide open and i am a light sleeper. If you plan to visit the Villa Borghese, this Hotel is five minutes walk away with all the other major attractions easily accessible, i would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: MikeShrewsburyUK
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here - longer than booked due to volcanic ash delays! The location is great - don't worry about the clubs mentioned as they are very discreet and the area is quiet. The desk staff were wonderful - amazingly helpful - and the breakfast is also superb. Nice public rooms and a lot of nice touches (complimentary fruit etc). We stayed in a junior suite, which was lovely. The only downsides we could find are that the room was warm at night (in April) and the charge of Euro 1.50 for a teabag in the room. Buy your own teabags - but otherwise unreservedly recommended for a great stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “ideal spot in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: realtor777
Reviews.Content: a charming botique hotel in a great location, walk to many attractions. service was excellent and we had a junior suite with sitting area and private patio. bathrooms modern and up to date. nite turn down was excellent with area rug, slippers. also complimentary fruit basket and bottled water. beautiful buffet breakfast in charming dining room. they responded to emails before we arrived and had everything ready for our stay, which included private transportation. Strongly recommend a stay here; we will do it again and suggest you do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, exactly as described. Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LBDublin
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you're looking for something different to a main hotel. Rooms are small but are clean and have everything you need. Staff are helpful and friendly. Location is great for walking the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best possible experience!”
Reviews.Author: kristinagrace
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, located in a quiet street and elegant neighbourhood. The service is impeccable, the rooms are more than adequate and the hotel provides beautiful touches with a free daily turn-down service, complimentary fruit baskets, free robes and slippers, etc. Friday night there is a complimentary cocktail hour as well! The hotel is ten to fifteen minute stroll from the top of the Spanish Steps and has a variety of fantastic restaurants, bars and even a jazz club within walking distance. We enjoyed our stay here immensely, recommend it to everyone with a moderate budget and look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: siasu
Reviews.Content: My parents included a trip to Rome as part of their 40th wedding anniversary vacation. The staff at La Residenza were wonderful, by all accounts - very attentive, friendly and helpful. The location was perfect, the breakfasts amazing and the lodgings were all they could want. As this trip was a gift from us kids, their report on La Residenza was good to hear.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mayDevon
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very friendly and helpful staff with excellent English. Very comfortable and spacious room for the four of us. Excellent breakfasts. Close to metro station at Barberini making it very easy to get to and from the airport and as a base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: capeTownLongdistance
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very central. The staff were really kind and helpful. The actual room was a bit dissapointing because the airconditioning was not very effective and the showers were hot & cold. Breakfast were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at La Residenza”
Reviews.Author: Surfdiva8
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at La Residenza. It was very centrally located, near public transportation and taxi station and within walking distance of Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon. We had room 107 which was spacious and had a small balcony. Morning breakfast was great. The staff was friendly and helpful arranging for airport pick-up and great tours for us of Vatican and Pompeii. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MeerkatNottingham
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel. Really friendly staff. Excellent choice in breakfast. Clean towels everyday, rooms cleaned to a high standard and pretty central to Spanish steps. Take flat shoes/trainers and just be aware of the cobbled streets as all the walking we did, absolutely hammered the soles of our feet. . . . . We found Rome a chilled city where you can stroll at your own pace.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tommouk1
Reviews.Content: Lovely room with a patio. Great breakfast and good location for all sights.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: fernandaolivier
Reviews.Content: We liked the Via Veneto area as it was just out of the centre of Rome, but only a 10-15 minute walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via del Corso etc and Via Veneto also has buses (including tour buses such as the 110) running along it and Barberini tube station is very close too. The hotel itself was small and comfortable. Our request for a quiet, twin room was met. The hotel was spotlessly clean, with huge self-service breakfasts - cake, pastries, cooked breakfast, yoghurt, cheese etc. etc. as much as you want. We went to the 'cocktail' party on Tuesday evening free for guests, but really it was a glass of wine with canapes but it was nice all the same to meet other guests. There was always plenty of hot water, clean towels. Sky News and BBC News 24 and CNN on TV. Our room at the back was very quiet. We booked on Booking.com and it cost us only 417 euros for 4 nights band b which we thought very good but for that you do get one of the smaller rooms. In the area however, there are very few restaurants other than Hard Rock cafe in Via Veneto. Don't go to La Pizzeria la Scala as the pizzas are small and you will get ripped off! Best restaurant for lunch is in central Rome - Enoteca Corsi but it doesn't do evening meal. Best day out is the Vatican museums and St. Peter's Basilica. Villa Borghese looked beautiful but I think you have to book. We also enjoyed travelling round on the tourist buses 110 which were frequent and you could hop on and hop off. It was very cold during our visit so we also got on for a bit if we were cold! Tip - if there is a queue for the Colosseum ticket booths, (which there is all the time!) walk along a bit to the Roman Forum ticket booth, where there is less of a queue, and get a joint forum and colosseum ticket and then go back to the Colosseum where you can then go straight in!

Reviews.Title: “Great return to "our" home in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: HappytrailsTucsonAZ
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to La Residenza; could not have been better! We arrived early from the US and were pretty jetlagged. Our room was ready by 10:30 a.m. which enabled us to unpack and unwind AND still go out and see some of the sights in Roma! Hotel rooms are wonderful -- large, airy and very well equipped. Internet access provided; incredible reception for guests the night we arrived. Location is superb -- close enough to Barberini and the Via Veneto for public transportation, yet far enough away to be quiet at night. Always feel very safe there. We definitely consider this "our" hotel in Roma, and we thank them very much for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ProfSlim
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Walk to all major attractions. We did not take a cab anywhere. If you are ambitious you can take a nice 30 minute walk to St. Peter's from this hotel. Great breakfast. Clean and tidy rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. There are two gentlemen clubs on the same street but they are very discrete and low-key. They are only open late at night with no noticeable noise or patrons outside of the clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Twice as Nice!”
Reviews.Author: clrohr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago and it's simply just as wonderful as last time. The breakfast has a wonderful selection of Italian pastries, fresh fruit, eggs cooked to order, cereals, etc....By hotel standards, you'd pay more than $15 a piece for a breakfast in the same Via Veneto area. Our room was charming! Heated towel racks, beds turned down at night with slippers by the bedside are just a few nice touches. We stayed in room 204, with a great verrandah with table on patio, couch, armchair and great sided bedroom. The bathrooms are large for Italian standards. The common rooms offer leather furniture, orientals on wood floors and frescos on the ceilings. Could they update the furnishings in bedrooms? Possibly, but the charm of the older furniture is perfect for the area. I can stay in modern hotels in any city. If you are looking for a "boutique" hotel, in a great neighborhood--look no further--this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Don't think we'll stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: psiworks
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon after reading great reviews about it. The rooms are clean but the decor and bathroom fixtures are definitely outdated, compared to other hotels we stayed at subsequently. On our first night, we asked the front desk for a restaurant recommendation and were told about a place in the neighborhood called Marcello's, which turned out to be the absolute worst, I mean WORST Italian food we've ever had. It's worse than your average Pasta Pomodoro in the States. Worse than the stuff that comes in jars sold at Costco. Just really bad food. The pasta was uncooked, not "al dente" or just a little chewy, but uncooked meaning when you chew on it you can taste the bits of flour as if you are eating raw pasta. Suffice to say, we did not enjoy our meal at all and would recommend future guests to not ask the staff at La Residenza for any restaurant recommendation. On the other hand, the breakfast provided by the hotel is pretty good. There's a diverse selection to choose from; it's the one good thing we can count on from the hotel. Also the neighborhood around Via Veneto is pretty nice. Overall I'd say it's been a fairly average experience. I'll definitely try other places next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Careful when booking for four”
Reviews.Author: lateagain2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week holiday in Italy. Our last stop was Rome and we stayed at La Residenza. There are four of us. My husband, myself and two teenage boys. This hotel offered accomodation for four which made me more comfortable having the boys in the same room as us. BIG MISTAKE! They have rooms for four, but the one we got, room 501 was at best a 2 star. This room was obviously as add on being at the top floor (no elevator access to it) and the ceilings were not even regular height. It felt like we were in a trailer. I was so dissappointed. One room had two twin beds which was ok but the other room and two wicker day beds with blankets on them that I wouldn't keep in the trunk of my car. The room had a really bad musty smell and the towels were grey and felt like sand paper. It was like this room was not a part of this hotel. When I went down to complain they were not accomodating at all. It was very frustrating. They showed me a couple of other rooms that weren't available until the next night so I knew this room was not their standard which made it more frustrating. This room should not be available to anyone. The next night when we swithched room, there was no musty smell, the towels were white and soft and the bedspreads were clean and not camping blankets. We had to pay more and they weren't too accomodating. We had to basically argue with them to switch rooms. If you are booking for four, it's woth calling ahead to make sure it's not room 501. .

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Residenza!”
Reviews.Author: bububr
Reviews.Content: We booked La Residenza based on price and location. Also based on the positive reviews on this site. We had three days in Italy prior to our cruise. Two were at this hotel. We were warmly greeted by the staff, and our room ;while it didn't have a great view ; was HUGE for a european hotel room, with two LARGE windows, a sofa, tv, desk, chair and coffee table, dresser, super big king size bed, clean and comfortable. Like most hotels in this area a bidet was also in the bathroom. On Fridays they have a complimentary cocktail party at 6:30 pm for all their guests. We had a blast and met many wonderful people, drank wonderful wines, and liquers and had some great snacks. Breakfast was included also in the cost of our room, and we took advantage of the wonderful buffet spread in the mornings. Everything from American items, plus they would cook eggs to order, to cold meats, fruits, traditional european items, cereals, and the best fresh baked breads and pastries. Coffee was served along with a variety of juices, teas and of course water. While this hotel does have two gentlemens clubs, one at each corner across the street, we didn't notice any noise or have any problems. This location was ideal for us . There was a bank ATM just across the main street, a cafe at the corner, a tabacchi ( tobacco shop) just two minutes away for cigs, stamps, etc... , an internet cafe is only 5 minutes away with really great rates, there are also a few nice restaurants within 5 to 10 minutes walking at a leasurely pace. The subways are also within walking distance and you could catch a bus at the corner of the street. We felt very safe at night. ALL of the sightsa are within walking distance and very accessable, however Rome is built on a hill so it is a bit like San francisco with cobble stone streets, so I would suggest comfortable shoes. At one point we had a problem with a credit card at a restaurant, we told the concierge at La Residenza and he was able to straighten it out for us. It was well appreciated. Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, Plaza Navarona, Pantheon and more are only a 10 to 15 minute walk from hotel. Cab fare to and from Termani station is about 15 euros depending on luggage. Sorry about the long review, but we just can't say enough about the wonderful time we had during our stay. Dave M.

Reviews.Title: “The house of yes”
Reviews.Author: benGalilee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days and have nothing but praise . It is quiet ,clean , well located near Villa Borghese and at walking distance from the Spanish Steps and a Metro connection . It has the best breakfast and good service . I nearly missed it because of some of the reviews e.g" the house of no " and it would have been a shame . The only negative points I can mention is the somehow greedy attitude of some of the staff in making bookings (do your own bookings ) and the fact that there is no Internet connection at a hotel that boasts four stars .

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rleNewEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights at La Residenza and the hotel was wonderful. The staff is very helpful with all things from buying stamps to making museum reservations. It is located in a nice part of the city and close to many restaruants and shops. Rome is a walking city and the hotel is a few blocks from the metro station. The Saturday evening cocktail party was quite nice. The roof top terrace was not fully open for the season, but we spent several sunny afternoons relaxing in this quite area. Our room was nice with lots of closet space and a mini refrig. The bathroom was large for Europe, complete with a bathtub. The usual noise from city streets was expected. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the last few days of our honeymoon here in July, 2006. We were a bit exhausted after a couple of weeks traveling around Italy (not that we were complaining!) and found La Residenza to be a welcome, quiet refuge. The staff was always nice to us and quite attentive (not always the case in Italy). The room was clean and comfortable, if not the most up-to-date. The bathroom was larger than many we encountered on our trip. The best part, though, was the fabulous breakfast buffet. It was truly gorgeous, with a wonderful variety of offerings, and got us started off on the right foot each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CnDeu
Reviews.Content: Christmas and New Years in Rome We stayed at "Hotel La Residenza" as the Italians say, which is located near via Veneto. It's away from major tourist spots; a perfect location. The hotel is beautiful - really beautiful - and the staff are great! They have a good balance of professional and friendly, not too much of either. The elevator was old, but the corridors stunning. So much that we took the stairs just to walk through this beautiful building. Our room was compact, but so pretty in deep burgundy, mustard, and shades of blue. The bed was comfortable, the heater was strong, and the shower felt amazing. What is it about hotels and bad lighting in the rooms? I would have done anything for a 100 watt light bulb! La Residenza provides delicious complimentary breakfast with an array of savory foods, both Italian and American - eggs, cheeses, meats, brioche, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, and to-die-for sweets. The coffee is strong and delicious. Note: Rome is cold in December. Really cold. The American embassy was around the corner. I wanted to visit, but they wouldn't let us in, even with American passports. I told the man that I wished to see what my taxes were paying for. He chuckled, and in good humor replied: "Write your congressman." Throughout Rome, the churches at night are spectacular (and warm), filled with people singing. The services were beautiful. There is so much to see and do while in Rome! It was even fun "grocery" shopping; the stores are so small. And everything in Rome is expensive! People's homes are really beautiful - the entrances, the front gates, the stairway, the decor. We walked and walked. The alleys; cobblestone streets; endless churches; nuns in habits (hadn't seen that in years); the Vatican. Viewing The Pieta nearly brought me to tears seeing the resignation on the Madonna's face. And after a long day, it was so great to come back to the hotel. A warm welcome from the staff when you collected the key. A quick conversation about the day/evening, tomorrow's plans. Sometimes a warm brandy downstairs at night, thinking about the day. Taking in Rome. This was an amazing trip, and LA RESIDENZA HOTEL was a great place to stay! Perfect location. Great staff. Beautiful accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Victim”
Reviews.Author: Bloodnok
Reviews.Content: Based on the many wonderful reviews, my wife and I chose this hotel to complete our 3 week Italy experience. We felt that one last night bathed in luxury would be a perfect end to a perfect holiday; a shame we didnt take heed of the other (negative) reviews........... Our room was on the ground floor at the back of the hotel with views of a) a brick wall and b) a car park. Complimenting the views was the sound of a neighbouring air-con unit that finally shut down at 8.00pm. Despite our protestations to the very unhelpful concierge ("this is a city, what do you expect?") that this was not value for money, we stuck with the room (out of sheer tiredness). One night, after all, can't kill us! The room: in the style of the 1970's! Bland, brown and decidedly unwelcoming. Be aware: the mini-bar list charges 1.50 euros for one tea-bag, that's if you don't mind black tea - we couldnt find any milk in the fridge! The tea/coffee basket contained half opened sugar and tea packs. We returned it to the front desk and it did not make another appearance! The staff: see above. Quite aggressive, in our view, when confronted with a perfectly reasonable complaint. Bathroom: cavernous, smelly and lacking a comfortably accessible shower. Television: no pay tv but a few non free-to-air channels. Overall: an overrated hotel. A very disappointing finale to our wonderful sojourn in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: NY-10022
Reviews.Content: After travelling through Sicily for 10 days and staying in their version of 4 star hotels (which by NY standards are 1 or 2 stars) We were more than pleased when we arrived at La Residenza. The staff was absolutely WONDERFUL, we stayed in a junior suite that had a king size bed, separate room with couch and table, another room with a 2 closets and a full balcony with 4 chairs, a table, an umbrella and lounge chair. The American breakfast buffet was outstanding with bacon, eggs to order, along with pastries, cheeses, fruit etc. The location of the hotel was in proximity to all the sites, we walked everywhere. Restaurants in the Via Veneto area are also wonderful. We would not hesitate recommending or staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: flattea
Reviews.Content: We booked this place for our honeymoon for 4 nights with junior suite. When arrived first thing we noticed was a lap dance club directly across from hotel. Reception was helpful in getting booked in, good english. However walking into the room was like walking into a time wrap. Everything from the 70's, there was a smell in the room. The bath/shower was covered in limescale. Dirty old carpets - think faulty towers and you know what i mean. We had booked a double room but it was a twin. I went down and asked to change as this was not what we booked. The porter said the manager was away for night and he was only person left so could not do anything. I said ok. Me and my wife decided later to take a walk. She noticed same manager in the back room and when he caught her looking at him tried to hide. I asked him to come out asked why I had been lied to. He said nothing. Anyway we went down the via veneto (very close) and found a gorgeous 4 star hotel (grand palace hotel) went in and booked for the same price. You simply could not believe the difference. We went back told manager we were leaving as the price simply did not match the standard of hotel and despite strong protestations from them, we left. Best thing we ever did, please look around before booking this hotel, I think it is 50% overpriced. Rooms are smelly and very outdated. Also internet service was outdated and expensive. This is from someone who has never written a hotel review and do not want other people falling into same trap

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, big bathroom, nice location”
Reviews.Author: dr_mucus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 3 day stay in Rome at the La Residenza. The room had a king size bed with modest space around it and a huge bathroom by European standards (shower/bath and sink separately by a door from toliet). It was clean and well decorated. The staff at the front desk were especially nice and helpful. The breakfast buffet was extensive and delicious. Easy walk to Spanish steps and good area restaurants. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The House Of NO”
Reviews.Author: nucleon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on numerous positive reviews on Trip Advisor and Expedia. Having now stayed in the hotel, I have to wonder if I accidentally went to a different property. The rooms were farily clean, but very, very dated. There was an ethernet connection for the included internet (no wireless), but the connection was hidden behind a bed. The bathroom was straight from the 1950's with retrofit shower in the middle of the bathtub, not at the end. There was a lot of mold and mildew in the bathtub. The folks at the front desk ranged from friendly to aloof. The doorman/desk clerk was very nice, and got us checked in with ease, but was often clueless as to recommendations for restaurants, or even places to cash a traveller's cheque. Of course, they could not or would not cash a check or change any money, and perhaps that is too much to expect for a small hotel. The location is quite good, just a block from Via Veneto. There are two lap-dance clubs across the street, but noise was minimal. We did see rats running around a trash can at the street corner the hotel borders. We never saw any others throughout Rome. The title of this review comes from a general attitude we found among many of the employees. We had hired private guides, and they were told in a rather nasty manner that NO, they could not wait in the lobby for us (they gave our names to the front desk by way of identification), but they would have to wait outside. NO, the front desk would not call and let us know that the guide had arrived. The worst of the "NO's" came from a young man I'll refer to as the "Breakfast Nazi". It was his mission in life to ensure that nothing left his breakfast room. We wanted to eat our breakfast on the little porch (that has two tables set for four) at the front of the hotel. "NO, you cannot take food out there!" was the refrain. Could we take coffee out there? "Only if you bring back the cup!" Just the kind of treatment I enjoy in the morning. I cannot in all good conscience recommend this hotel. It is a fairly good value given its location, but the unpleasantries ruined that advantage for us.

Reviews.Title: “loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: laura818
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here and loved everything. We arrived late from the US and left early the next day for a cruise and were very pleased with our room. We had a suite for 4 people and the room was very large. The breakfast was wonderful. They offered made to order eggs and a large selection of grilled vegetables, breads, fruits, muffins, etc. The room was very nice. The hotel had a nice courtyard entry and they were very nice here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: caganH
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Rome got off to a bad start when we got overcharged by a very aggressive and rude taxi driver. I'm happy to say that our mood changed when we walked into the hotel to be greeted by their very friendly staff. Check in was quick and easy and our bags were taken up to the room all within a couple of minutes. The room itself was huge with 2 double beds, a vast bank of wardrobes (containing an electronic safe), tea and coffee facilities and a tv. A fruit basket and 2 bottles of water were waiting on the table for us by the balcony. The bathroom was a strange shape which made some things difficult, but was very clean and well stocked with compliementary items. Breakfast at the hotel is included and is fantastic. It is a buffet style with eggs etc cooked to order. Fruit, pastries, cereals, meats and cheeses are also on offer so there is something for every appetite. The hotel is handily placed for the Via Veneto and the Barberini Metro station is a couple of minutes walk away. There is a "girly" bar on the corner of the street opposite, but we didn't hear any customer or music noise during the night, in fact for a city centre hotel, it was amazingly quiet. I would stay at La Residenza again and would happily recommend it to anyone wanting a quality hotel at a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: cowboys-son
Reviews.Content: La Residenza was recommended by our wives friend, who has visited Rome many times. Checking the Trip Advisor’s positive reviews, we changed our original hotel plans and booked junior suites at La Residenza. Upon arrival we knew we had made the right decision. The warm greetings of the hotel’s staff made us immediately feel at home in the immaculate and beautifully maintained converted villa. The bedrooms are spacious with a large wardrobe that also contains a refrigerator and safe (our room also had a sitting room and terrace with table & chairs overlooking Via Emilia) The bathrooms are equally spacious and stocked with fluffy robes, towels, fine toiletries plus our European favorite, the towel warming rack. Breakfast was an additional plus, offering cooked-to-order eggs & omelets and a vast array of beautifully displayed fruits, breads, cheeses, juices and breakfast meats. The location is within a short walk to many of the surrounding sights i.e. Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps; for locations further away the front desk had taxis within 5 minutes. Desk staff was especially helpful recommending restaurants and sights. They can also arrange personal guides for 50 euros an hour. I believe some reviews mentioned the lap-dance bar across the street and one at the corner. Neither proved to be a problem and in fact their signs provided good navigational points when returning to the hotel at night. Our stay at La Residenza, combined with the history, food and Italian hospitality created the perfect Roman holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Full Marks”
Reviews.Author: markied68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at La Residenza and have nothing but praise for the hotel. The location is first class. The room was a very nice size and very quiet (for Rome). The bathroom was good too. As good as the room and the location was, our favourite things about the hotel are: 1. The staff. They are all friendly, helpful and the service was attentive without being obtrusive. 2. The breakfast. The best we have had in Europe by far. The only real reason for not giving full marks was that they didn't take American Express, if I could have given 4.5 out of 5 I would.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Romelovers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from La Residenza after staying in Rome for 8 days with a break in between to go to Venice. We absolutely loved the hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The first room we had was very nice and quiet. When we returned from Venice we had a nice surprise waiting for us. Room 501..... an amazing suite with a huge terrace and two separate rooms. What a terrific, romantic way to end a fantastic vacation. The hotel is nicely situated and we walked everywhere, except to the Vatican but the metro was close and easy to use. The breakfast was the best we've had and there was such a variety. We ate so much that we would skip lunch and just eat gelattos instead. I highly recommed this hotel and will definetely stay here again. Grazie Antonello and Stefan

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful in Roma”
Reviews.Author: rockesfans
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel to return home to after a day of sight seeing. Very friendly and helpful staff. From the lobby are several comfortable sitting rooms with classical music played throughout., very classy. Sat night was a cocktail party with a wonderful harpist. The breakfast was the best we had had in Rome. Our room was spacious, clean and quiet. We loved the location as we were able to walk everywhere except the Vatican. Staff showed us where to get the Metro, which stop to take etc. Even though the price was high for US standards ., we thought it was very reasonable for Rome

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: heatonspair
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July 2006 and found this to be a fantastic hotel. Lovely area, great service and a very comfortable room. We stayed for the weekend, when we arrived we were invited to the manager's cocktail party on the saturday evening as were all the guests. While turning up to be sociable and expecting a complimentary cocktail, we were very pleasantly suprised to find a free bar from 6-8pm and a sumptuous buffet. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: CPow
Reviews.Content: We completely enjoyed our first visit to Rome and the La Residenza was part of the reason we enjoyed it so very much! We were absolutely satisfied with this charming hotel. We booked a Junior Suite and were very surprised at the size - it was huge! The hotel provided everything possible for a wonderful stay. The staff was TERRIFIC ! They did everything they could to make us comfortable and to meet whatever need we might have. And the breakfast (included in the price).... IT WAS FABULOUS!! The choices were varied and many... there would be no excuse for anyone to walk away hungry! On our next trip to Rome (and I certainly hope there is another trip - what a fabulous city!!), we will definitely stay at the La Residenza. I just don't think we could find a more satisfying hotel! Well done, La Residenza!!

Reviews.Title: “be aware!!”
Reviews.Author: Iratxe
