Reviews.Content: In February I spent 4 days at this hotel with my sister. The hotel was great, good located, close to all the amenities, and it had a few nice restaurants and terraces nearby. We thought we had found a gem in a lovely area in Rome! Staff were always helpful and polite and the breakast was excellent. The room and the bathroom were of good size. I even recommended the hotel to a work colleague that was going to visit Italy in May. When checking out, I paid using my debit card. I had to enter my PIN number. This is the only time that I used my card while we were in Rome because we took some euros with us and that covered our food, drinks, etc. On March, 30th, 1month after we came back, some money was taken from an ATM in Italy using my card and PIN number , two occasions, same day, about 400 euros in total . I still have the card with me so it was not lost or stolen. I contacted the hotel to let them know what had happened and I have also told my bank and police. The hotel repplied to me saying that they guarantee it was not one of their staff. I'm not accusing the hotel , but I think it's too much of a coincidence that someone cloned my card, got my pin number and that cloned card was used in Italy, just one month after we went there. If I were you and you are staying at this hotel, I would make sure I pay cash!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: chilenitaHolland
Reviews.Content: I had the most fantastic 5 days in Rome and a great experience at La Residenzia Hotel . I arrived early at Leonardo da Vinci airport, took the leonardo express train to termini station, then the metro to Barberini station and walked 5 minutes to the hotel. As soon as I arrived at the hotel I was helped with my luggage and checked in, even though it was way too early for that. I had booked a double standard room and was told that due to the hotel being completly full I would be upgraded to a junior suite, regardless of the fact that I had a super discount internet rate!. Once in the room I was greeted with a complimentary fruit basket. The room was super big, comfortable and very clean, the double bed was enormous and there was also an additional single bed in a little side room. The bathroom was also very clean, fully equipt, plenty of towels and bathrobes. The room also had a rather large terrace with a table and chairs, overlooking the entrance garden and the street. Breakfast was served on the ground floor in a dinning or breakfast room, everyday there was a good selection of fresh fruits, pastries, breads, eggs, cereals etc... enough choices to satisfy everyone i should think. The staff was very helpful, polite and offered all sorts of information and advice. I was also invited to attend a cocktail party for all the guests... but unfortunatly could not make it. Its a well located, quiet and very pleasant hotel in a REALLY quiet neighbourhood but close enough to every mayor attraction, its only a 5 mins walk to the metro and 5-10 mins to the spanish steps. Personally I only used the subway when I went to the Vatican and all the rest I did walking. Overall I had the best experience at La Residenzia, I honestly didn't know what to expect since I had heard so many things about hotels in Rome, but I'm SO happy I made this choice. I would definetly come back and stay again and I really recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Breakfast, Take your own teabags!”
Reviews.Author: Zephirus
Reviews.Content: After a long time spent researching hotels in Rome for first visit, (most with very conflicting reviews), eventually chose this hotel because of 90% good reviews (plus one not so - see more later.) Pleased with choice and would stay again/tell friends - hotel built around 1930's and has traditional frontage, lovely lobby and ground floor. Booked a junior suite as good rate from Expedia. Huge bedroom/sitting room and balcony (see photos). Very clean. Very large bed that was essential after tiring day sightseeing. Bathroom large with shower/tub enclosed by sliding doors. Shower central over bath. Plenty of hot water, but shower head not very adjustable (small point but easy to improve). A kettle was available in the room - but note the tea bags and coffee will be chargeable to the mini bar so take your own! (about 50p a tea bag.) Hotel staff very friendly (including the cleaning staff) and helpful, and spoke very good english, but dont let that stop you from trying your italian out. Received basket of fruit in room on return from sightseeing. Breakfast was a delight in the lower ground floor. Plenty of variety of hot/cold food (cooked to order as well) from about 6.45 am and extremely pleasant staff. They also will get you piping hot water for tea if you ask!! Hotel situated in a small side street just off Via Veneto, 10 minutes walk to Borghese park, 10 minutes walk to Spanish steps, 20 minutes walk to Trevi fountain, a leisurely 30min walk to the Colleseum. It is about 20 minutes walk uphill from the train/bus Terminus to the hotel, so would recommend taxi if you have luggage. (Note: The Easyjet ATS airport taxi transfer was good value and quick.). The via veneto is just round the corner with its multitude of restaurants - excellent food and service, but the prices are not cheap - 70 euros upwards for a 3 course meal. The Piazza Barberini is a 5 minute walk from the hotel - (use the steps on the right as you come out of the hotel) - it is a good shortcut where you can catch the hop-on Rome tourist bus 110 (all day ticket - not cheap but great for seeing all the sites with a commentary). Also you can get a bus from here to drop you by the Vatican museuem sfrom here (I think it was the 492). The Vatican is a long walk away from the hotel. Also at Barberini is the metro - I would not reccomend using the metro - was dark, dirty, grafitti and beggars. Rome is built for walking around! When researching this hotel came across a review which mentioned dubious clubs and the like in the area. To give a balanced view - yes there is a "gentlemans private club" along the street (see photo), and others round the other hotels in this area, but they all appear to be located in basement areas with closed doors or secure entry. I can honestly say it did not interfere with the stay at all, and have seen much worse in town centres pubs/clubs.

Reviews.Title: “diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Joeyell
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. It is located close to the spanish steps. Our room was small but clean. The bathroom was huge and so was our bed. The room had air conditioning, and a safe for our valuables. The Staff was extremely helpful. The louge area and breakfast room, where we ate our free breakfast, was beautiful. During the week, I think Tues, they had a lounge get together for all the guests in the hotel. They had free drinks and finger foods and we got to talk with other guests. The hotel is right in the tourist area, and finding a restaurant is no problem. The hotel is also very close to the subway, bus stops and an internet cafe. This hotel was worth every penny we paid. This goes to show not to judge a book by it's cover. Excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Residenza”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEh
Reviews.Content: Our room at the hotel was much larger than we expected in Rome. The street was quiet, and within walking distance of all the major attractions. The hot breakfasts were delicious and extensive, and they would make any requested extras that were not on the buffet e.g. cappucino, egg white omelets. Staff were very helpful. and pleasant. I forgot some of my clothes there after we moved on, and did not realize it for 3 days. They had everything intact for me when I called. Our only complaint was that they referred us to a restaurant our 1st night which cost more than twice what any other restaurant charged us during our week in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Peteimus
Reviews.Content: We had two marvellous days here - another reviewer has said its like being a guest in a relative's house - and it is just that - the front of house staff are friendly and courteous to a fault, nothing is too much trouble and all requests were met with such quiet efficiency we were speechless on occasions. Our room a "junior suite" was superb - HUGE bed - spacious reading area - great bathroom and we had our own terrace as well! The varied eat as much as you like breakfast is an intimate affair - the tables are set for two people - and we were embarrassed to witness a "hissy fit" by another guest who wanted to rearrange the breakfast room furniture and demanded the manager be brought forth. We therefore dont recommend this hotel for families whose children need supervision while eating!! La Residenza is a minutes walk from via Veneto, the Villa Borghese, the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. They do not do evening meals as far as we noticed and Via Veneto has inflated prices - being near the Embassies. However dining locally we have to recommend The White Elephant for an upmarket but superb dinner. As far as getting around Rome goes, via Veneto is 45 seconds walk away with its ample transport links and we recommend getting a day ticket on the ATAF 110 red bus for getting around sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: JamesWillson
Reviews.Content: I think you would struggle to find a better value hotel in central Rome! Spacious air-conditioned room & bathroom, excellent breakfast choice, staff couldnt have been friendlier & were very helpful. Reception areas immaculate and decorative. Central enough that all the sights within walking distance, but off the main drag so quieter at night. Do bring your own coffee/tea though, as what they give you is neither good nor cheap! A GREAT HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was perfect. The staff couldn't do enough for us. The rooms were spacious and immaculate. Loved the heated towel rack in the bathroom. The breakfast was a feast each morning. Saturday evening cocktails were cold and delicious. Try the Bellinis!! I can't imagine staying anywhere else when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in Hotel La Residenza for two nights in early June. The location is excellent. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a good sized bathroom. In addition, the front desk staff were more than accommodating, pleasant and helpful. However there are two nightclubs right in front of the hotel, and the clubs didn't close until 4:00am! We were unable to sleep all night, numbers of people were talking loud !! Not a good choice for light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, Staff and Value”
Reviews.Author: ord60
Reviews.Content: After much research, we stayed at LaResidenza for eight nights and found it to be a great all-around hotel at a reasonable price, considering It is within blocks of many prestigious hotels which charge at least fifty percent more than LaResidenza. Our room was clean and reasonably spacious. The manager, Emmanuel, and the front desk staff, as well as the breakfast room staff were all responsive and friendly. The hotel was within walking distance of all major sights, with even the Vatican being less than a forty minute walk away. Having seen other hotels while in Rome, LaResidenza will definitely be our first choice when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Breakfast! , Good Value, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Travel007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Residenza in June of 2003. This is a nice little hotel in the heart of Rome. Breakfast is not a big deal in Italy, but this hotel knows that lots of its customers are American, so the breakfast is fantastic. ( ie. big buffet!) You are minutes from the spansih steps, and a short taxi ride to the vatican and the coleseum. The room was nice, and very clean. I would stay there again without even thinking about it. And you can't beat the price! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jellz
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us stayed several days at La Residenza in October, 2005. We loved it! Small but quietly elegant in a comfortable way. Very easy to get to all the sights ... bus and metro very convenient. The front desk was very helpful in arranging transportation and excursions for us. There was a little snafu in the reservation for a family of three who were traveling with us - apparently there was some miscommunication about the dates - however, they were very happy to be offered the "penthouse" suite - commplete with a very large deck. We opted to take dinner and wine to their rooftop deck one night to enjoy the fresh air and ambiance in lieu of eating out. The breakfast buffet is more than substantial and delicious. My boyfriend and I were booked into one of the lobby level rooms and I was a little concerned about noise ... however we were never disturbed. The only problem was trying to figure out the air conditioning. Not sure if there even was any. On arrival we had a nice basket of fruit awaiting. Accommodations in Europe can be a lot different than standards in our country ... La Residenza was a very nice surprise. We would stay there again if we ever have the good fortune to visit Rome in the future. Andy

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: PAUL DUNS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just plain adequate.. If you can get a hotel for a similar price nearer town then take it.. Found the concierge and other reception staff very unhelpful to the point of being rude ..The lady at reception and the staff doing breakfasts however were pleasant and helpful ...My room looked onto two gentlemens clubs? Got a little noisy at night ..We also got the hotel to arrange tickets for an audience with the pope but when we collected the tickets from the guy at reception we were informed that it cost 20.00 euros for the tickets ( courier charge)..we were not told this at any time prior to this...I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL....

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Avon by the Sea, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we booked this reservation we took a shot. We were tied into a certain amount of money to spend. We read travel books and decided on La Residenza. We knew the location but nothing about the hotel. We found it to be a great find. Reasonable prices, clean rooms, excellent breakfast and more important, very helpful hotel employees. Jerry Wallace, New Jersey, USA

Reviews.Title: “A haven”
Reviews.Author: TheLetterB
Reviews.Content: We picked La Residenza using TripAdvisor, and were really pleased with our choice. We stayed there six nights, at the beginning of September. Our room had the unexpected bonus of a balcony, but was also spacious, clean and very comfortable (we were extremely glad of the air conditioning). The staff were extremely friendly, and our breakfast waiter even allowed me to try out my Italian on him, despite his flawless English. La Residenza's location is great. I would definitely return to this hotel if in Rome again, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHEMM
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel which is very central, we spent three days in Rome and walked to most main attractions from the hotel including the Spanish Steps and the gorgeous Trevi Fountain. A walk to the Vatican isn't too far, although by day three we decided to hop on the Metro to visit the Colloseum. There is a metro station a very close walk from the hotel and the metro system is very easy to fathom out consisting of only Line A & Line B so you can't go wrong. La Residenza is near to a good choice of restaurants, it's worth turning left and right out of the hotel to find places to eat. The hotel was very well decorated & very italian in style. Our Room was spacious and clean, not that we spent much time there anyway. The Staff were helpful & friendly, & the breakfast was fantastic including sausages, bacon, beans, eggs, breads, meats, cheeses, cereals, fruit, cakes, pastries etc..... which will keep you more than full until lunch time. If I were to return to Rome, I would return to the Residenza as was very pleased with its location and standard.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at this hotel, once just my wife and I and then with our daughter and granddaughter, who was only just 1 year old. Each time the service was excellent, the staff friendly, professional and just so very interested in ensuring that we had an excellent time. They were genuinely interested in our granddaughter, which for grandparents is a MUST and also a real example of the range of ages they cater to. Breakfast was the main feature - just enormous and very filling, and for dinner there are at least 3 restaurants within a three-minute walk. There are three banks in equal walking distance with cash machines, a street flower vendor, magazine stalls and a taxi rank. Cafés can be found also in the same general location which bustle at night. The Hotel has a very 1940’s/1950’s feel to the décor which adds to the charm, since for us staying in modern and bland rooms is a negative. The air conditioning is ok to good (depending on the room), bathrooms small but very well equipped. The Hotel has limited parking and as a result allow a little extra time to manoeuvre your car out. There is also a nearby sandwich bar for evening snacks. The Hotel also has a list of private drivers you can hire if you are planning a trip outside of Rome. This is just simply a marvellous hotel with marvellous staff, at affordable rates in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travlibe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night because our first choice was not available at the last minute and we booked in desperation. We couldn't have been more pleased: very attentive and friendly staff, fabulous buffet breakfast, and nice touches like robes and heated towels in the rooms. Location was fairly quiet and less than a ten minute walk to the top of the Spanish steps. We definitely lucked out and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, with a confirmed reservation made three months earlier, they had no room for us. They arranged for us to stay in a poor substitute, at the same rate and offered no compensation nor apology. We were treated poorly and wrote several letters to the General Manager who did not have the decency to reply. I suggest finding a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Cozy But Crammed”
Reviews.Author: hossem
Reviews.Content: We were there 5 nights from oct 8-oct 13. Definitely the best thing about this hotel is its buffet breakfast, which is enormous compared to other European hotels, but still average versus American buffets. Considering the price (approx 240USD) and rating (4 star), you would expect a top flight hotel all around. but the biggest drawback was the size of the room. While nicely decorated, it was the size of a sandbox. My wife and i had to tiptoe around each other or walk along the beds to avoid running each other over. We did have a balcony which was useless because it was faced the side of a building and was small (of course) and dirty. That being said, you're probably not going to spend alot of time in your room in Rome, as you will be out and about seeing the sites, so if you're willing to overlook these minor irritations, you should fare fine. The hotel is centrally located near restaurants, internet cafe, and a few shops, and a 10 minute walk from the Spanish Steps. The staff was very friendly and the busboy was helpful in providing nightlife tips. They were also very prompt in addressing special requests. I'm probably reiterating what alot of other people are posting, but one tidbit no one mentioned which might affect a family with kids is that there are 2 "gentleman" clubs directly across the street. They're pretty private in that there are no rowdy crowds, but there's always a couple of guys hanging ouside of "Chica Chica Boom Boom" trying to get you to venture in. In summary, the hotel served its purpose for our needs in Rome, but its nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, mediocre location”
Reviews.Author: talkingstick
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in September 2004. It was a pleasant spot. The breakfast was very good. The rooms were very spacious and reasonably appointed. The location isn't the best or the worst. Although it is close to Via Venuto it is a decent walk from everything except the Villa Borghese. The staff was pleasant and considerate.

HotelInfo.Name: La Residenza
